item.title: Ruby's Regexp Class
item.description: A regular expression (regex) is a sequence of characters that define how to search and match patterns in a string. It is commonly used in all modern programming languages like Java, Ruby, and Python. Ruby uses the class Regexp to store a regex. Regexp are delimited using the following literals and constructor: /.../ %r{...} Regexp::new You can call the match() method to check whether a string contains the pattern. For instance:
